intro: Heptapleurum productum, commonly known as the hairy stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It is a member of the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or woodland habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and long blooming period. Heptapleurum productum is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
